macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Rally Ahead of FOMC Meeting; Gold Crosses $5,000
items.summary: Major US indices gained on Monday with the Dow Jones rising 0.68%, S&P 500 up 0.63%, and Nasdaq 100 gaining 0.59%, driven by tech strength and safe-haven demand as gold surged past $5,000 per ounce for the first time amid geopolitical tensions.

items.title: Dollar Tumbles on Yen Intervention Speculation
items.summary: The US dollar fell more than 3% since Friday following the New York Fed's rare check of dollar/yen rates, with speculation mounting over potential direct yen-buying intervention to support the Japanese currency.

items.title: Federal Reserve Policy Decision and Chair Announcement Expected This Week
items.summary: The Federal Reserve begins a two-day policy meeting on January 27-28, with markets pricing in only a 3% chance of a rate cut, while the announcement of the next Fed Chair is expected before the end of January.

items.title: Intel Shares Plunge 17% on Weak AI Chip Guidance
items.summary: Intel's stock fell as much as 17% on Friday following disappointing guidance and challenges in meeting AI chip demand, contributing to sector volatility.

items.title: Tesla Gains 4% on Elon Musk's FSD and Robotaxi Announcements
items.summary: Tesla's share price rose 4% on Thursday after CEO Elon Musk announced at Davos that full self-driving approval is expected in Europe and China by February, with widespread US robotaxi deployment planned by year-end.

items.title: Major Tech Earnings Week Ahead with Magnificent Seven Companies Reporting
items.summary: Four Magnificent Seven companies are scheduled to report earnings this week, with Microsoft leading tech sector gains and market focus on AI-related growth expectations.

items.title: Silver Surges 6% as Safe-Haven Demand Intensifies
items.summary: Silver rallied 6% (up as much as 13% intraday) alongside gold's record high, driven by hedging against political risks including tariff threats and US shutdown concerns.

items.title: Hang Seng Index Consolidates Near 26,800 with Mixed Momentum
items.summary: Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index registered minimal movement at -0.3% last week despite robust southbound net inflows, consolidating near 26,800 as the MACD indicator approaches a negative crossover.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Drops 1.11% to $2.99T as Bitcoin Trades at $87,807
items.summary: The cryptocurrency market cap fell 1.11% to $2.99T in the last 24 hours, with Bitcoin down 0.73% between $86,075 and $88,972. Major coins like ETH (-1.53%), SOL (-3.36%), and others also declined, while RESOLV, AUCTION, and DODO gained up to 28%.

items.title: CFTC and SEC Reschedule Joint Event on Crypto Regulatory Harmonization to Jan. 29
items.summary: CFTC Chairman Michael S. Selig and SEC Chairman Paul S. Atkins rescheduled their joint event on agency harmonization and U.S. leadership in crypto from Jan. 27 to Jan. 29. The discussion aims to clarify regulatory boundaries and promote innovation under American law.

items.title: Japan Plans to Legalize Crypto ETFs by 2028 Amid Asia's Regulatory Push
items.summary: Japan is set to legalize cryptocurrency ETFs by 2028 as part of accelerating regulatory developments in Asia. This comes alongside global crypto funding exceeding $222 million last week.

items.title: Spot Bitcoin ETFs See $1.32 Billion Net Outflows in Late January
items.summary: Bitcoin ETFs recorded $1.32 billion in net outflows over four sessions from Jan. 20-23, including a $708.7 million exit on Jan. 21, amid fading risk appetite. Earlier inflows hit $840 million on Jan. 14 when BTC topped $97,000.

items.title: iShares Digital Assets Issues 960,000 Bitcoin ETP Securities on London Stock Exchange
items.summary: iShares Digital Assets issued 960,000 Bitcoin ETP securities at $8.90 each, set for trading on the London Stock Exchange's Main Market starting January 27, 2026.

items.title: UK Financial Authority Nears End of Crypto Regulation Consultations
items.summary: The UK Financial Authority is approaching completion of its crypto regulation consultations. Separately, institutional investors view Bitcoin as undervalued per a new survey.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: KAIST Develops AI Framework to Predict Battery Cathode Particle Size with 86.6% Accuracy
items.summary: Researchers at KAIST created a machine learning model that predicts battery material particle sizes from incomplete data, providing reliability scores to reduce experiments and accelerate development. The framework combines MatImpute for data supplementation and NGBoost for uncertainty estimation.

items.title: University at Buffalo AI Model Predicts Cardiac Patient Readmissions with 95% Accuracy
items.summary: A machine learning model developed by researchers predicts 90-day hospital readmissions for cardiac patients by analyzing survey data on factors like heart disease, medications, and demographics. Findings published in British Medical Journal Health and Care Informatics aim to enable targeted interventions.

items.title: NHS Launches AI and Robot Pilot for Earlier Lung Cancer Detection
items.summary: The UK's NHS has initiated a pioneering pilot using AI and robotics to detect lung cancer sooner, integrated with a screening program addressing cancer inequalities.

items.title: CSIS Warns of Governance Gaps Due to Confusion Over Agentic AI Definitions
items.summary: A CSIS analysis highlights inconsistencies in defining 'agentic AI' across industry players like IBM, AWS, and OpenAI, risking flawed procurement, accountability issues, and mismatches in high-stakes environments like national security. It proposes a capability-based taxonomy.
items.source: Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS)

items.title: Retresco Releases Adaptive Frontend Widget for Brand-Safe RAG Chatbot Deployment
items.summary: Retresco unveiled a new adaptive frontend widget enabling simple, scalable launches of AI chatbots and Q&A systems from pilot to production while ensuring brand safety.

items.title: Study Reveals Misleading Physical Text Can Hijack AI-Enabled Robots
items.summary: Researchers demonstrate how deceptive text in real-world environments can manipulate autonomous robot decision-making, with proposed defenses outlined.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Virtuix Files for Nasdaq IPO to Expand VR Treadmills
items.summary: Virtuix, maker of omni-directional VR treadmills for gaming, fitness, and enterprise, has filed for a Nasdaq Global Market IPO with shares expected to begin trading on or about January 27, 2026, amid projected VR headset market growth at 19.7% CAGR.

items.title: New Video Games Launching This Week (Jan 26-Feb 1)
items.summary: Several notable video games are releasing on PC and consoles from January 26 to February 1, 2026, as highlighted in a weekly roundup guide.

items.title: Ubisoft Plans to Cut Up to 200 Jobs at French Headquarters
items.summary: Ubisoft is entering discussions to cut as many as 200 jobs at its French headquarters as part of a restructuring, expecting a €1 billion loss in fiscal year 2025-2026 due to writedowns and recent game underperformances.

items.title: Saudi Arabia's Savvy Games Group and NEOM Partner on Gaming Startups
items.summary: On January 26, 2026, Savvy Games Group and NEOM signed an MoU to support Saudi gaming startups via incubators and accelerators, aiming to boost the local industry amid rapid growth.

items.title: GTA 6 Pricing Leaks Suggest $70 Launch, India at ₹7,199
items.summary: Leaks indicate GTA 6 may launch at $70-$79.99 rather than $100, with an India price around ₹7,199 and a release date of November 19, 2026, amid discussions on AAA game pricing trends.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
